framework_gap.description: .NET Framework 4.8.1 to .NET 10 is a major leap requiring significant changes

architecture_patterns.description: Heavy use of legacy patterns: WCF, MSMQ, Session state all need replacement

windows_dependencies.description: MSMQ and WCF are Windows-specific and need cloud-native alternatives

codebase_size.description: Relatively small codebase with 3 projects makes migration more manageable

third_party_dependencies.description: Moderate number of NuGet packages, mostly UI libraries that have .NET Core equivalents

containerization_readiness.description: No existing container support; Windows dependencies make this challenging

complexity_analysis.justification: The application requires significant modernization effort due to legacy .NET Framework patterns and Windows-specific dependencies. WCF and MSMQ are deprecated technologies requiring complete replacement. However, the codebase is relatively small and well-structured, which reduces complexity. The main challenges are architectural changes rather than code volume.

risks.risk: WCF to REST/gRPC migration may require contract changes
risks.mitigation: Create compatibility layer or versioned APIs

risks.risk: MSMQ to Azure Service Bus requires infrastructure changes
risks.mitigation: Implement message abstraction layer for easy switching

risks.risk: Session state migration may affect user experience
risks.mitigation: Implement distributed cache early and test thoroughly

risks.risk: No existing tests to validate behavior
risks.mitigation: Create integration tests before and after migration

risks.risk: Windows-specific features (MSMQ) won't work in Linux containers
risks.mitigation: Replace with Azure Service Bus before containerization
